assessmentMetadata.title: Digital Twin Career Snapshot
assessmentMetadata.subtitle: 10 Deeply Diagnostic Questions for Career Clarity
assessmentMetadata.description: A focused assessment to map your current career alignment, energy, and readiness for transformation.

questions.question: How connected do you feel to your deeper purpose through your current professional role?

options.text: I feel deeply aligned — my work expresses who I am becoming.
I feel meaning occasionally, but it's inconsistent or fragile.
I like what I do, but I'm not sure it reflects my deeper purpose.
I've grown detached — it feels like I'm on autopilot most days.
My purpose is clear, but my work does not support it yet.
I sense an emerging purpose, but I can't articulate it fully.
I'm questioning everything — my identity, values, direction.
I feel stuck in a role that no longer fits who I'm becoming.
I don't know my purpose, but I feel a pull toward something new.
I'm reinventing myself and searching for a more meaningful identity.

questions.question: When do you most experience flow or 'lose track of time' while working?

options.text: When solving problems that stretch me intellectually.
When I'm creating, building, or designing something new.
When I'm helping people, coaching, or empowering others.
When I'm organizing chaos and bringing clarity to complexity.
When I'm analyzing patterns, data, or systems.
When I'm strategizing about the future or long-term direction.
When I'm collaborating with motivated, high-energy people.
When I'm working independently without interruptions.
I rarely experience flow — work feels fragmented or draining.
I don't know yet — my strengths feel undeveloped or hidden.

questions.question: How do you perceive your current career growth trajectory?

options.text: Upward and accelerating — I'm gaining momentum.
Growing steadily but not exponentially.
Stable, predictable, and comfortable.
Growing externally, but internally I feel stagnant.
I'm plateauing — growth feels slower than it should.
My trajectory is unclear — I'm still finding the path.
I feel misaligned — I'm growing, but in the wrong direction.
I've hit a wall — progress feels blocked or political.
I'm preparing for a major pivot, even if it's not visible yet.
I feel lost — I don't know where this path is taking me.

questions.question: Which statement best describes your emotional relationship with work right now?

options.text: I feel energized — work stretches me in meaningful ways.
I feel engaged but wish my emotional connection was deeper.
I feel neutral — work gets done, but it doesn't move me.
I feel emotionally distant — like I'm watching myself work.
I'm productive, but I've lost joy and spark in the process.
I feel drained — not because of work, but because of constant context switching.
Work feels heavier lately — small things take more emotional effort.
I feel undervalued or unseen, which affects my energy.
I'm functioning, but I'm on emotional autopilot.
I feel like I need a reset — emotionally, mentally, or directionally.

questions.question: How would you describe your typical weekly energy and workload experience?

options.text: Balanced — I end most weeks with fuel left in the tank.
Manageable — some weeks are heavy, but I recover well.
Variable — energy swings depending on tasks or people.
Sustained pressure — doable but tiring.
Always 'on' — difficult to disconnect fully.
Overextended — I manage, but barely.
Mentally overloaded — too many tasks, not enough space.
Physically exhausted — my body feels the strain before my mind does.
Running on reserve energy — recovery isn't happening.
In burnout zone — I'm functioning but emotionally depleted.

questions.question: If you could change one cultural aspect of your workplace, what would it be?

options.text: More transparency in communication and decisions.
More trust — less micromanagement and control.
More recognition — people deserve to be seen.
More fairness — fewer favorites, clearer merit.
More psychological safety — freedom to speak honestly.
More collaboration — less siloed, more collective energy.
More innovation — fewer layers, more experimentation.
More empathy — leaders understanding human realities.
More clarity — clearer goals, roles, expectations.
Less politics — more authenticity and real conversations.

questions.question: How would you describe the impact your current leadership/manager has on your energy and confidence?

options.text: They elevate me — I grow faster because of them.
They support me — I feel safe to stretch myself.
They guide me, but our styles don't fully match.
They're neutral — neither draining nor inspiring.
They're distant — I'm left to navigate things alone.
They're inconsistent — some days empowering, some days draining.
They're demanding — growth happens but with emotional weight.
They unintentionally drain me — communication gaps or unclear direction.
They limit me — my confidence dips around them.
They exhaust me — I'm operating in survival mode.

questions.question: When you reflect on your work and life, which statement feels most accurate?

options.text: My work aligns beautifully with what I stand for.
My values guide my decisions, and work supports them.
I'm aligned internally, but my environment doesn't always reflect it.
I'm clear about my values, but not fully living them.
I know my values, but I'm unsure how they fit into my career.
My values are shifting — I'm evolving.
I feel a growing mismatch between what I do and who I am.
I'm questioning whether my career truly reflects my identity.
I feel pulled between personal meaning and external pressures.
I feel disconnected — I need a deeper sense of direction.

questions.question: How do you emotionally view your next big career change or reinvention?

options.text: Excited — I'm ready to leap.
Open — I'm eager to explore new directions.
Curious — I sense something bigger is calling me.
Prepared — I've been building toward this.
Cautiously optimistic — I want to move, but with stability.
Undecided — I feel the shift coming but can't define it yet.
Anxious — too many unknowns, not enough clarity.
Conflicted — part of me wants change, part of me resists.
Fearful — change feels overwhelming right now.
Stuck — I know I need reinvention, but don't know where to begin.

questions.question: If fear, money, and expectations were removed, what would you love your life's work to express?

options.text: Creativity — building, designing, expressing ideas.
Impact — improving lives and contributing meaningfully.
Mastery — becoming exceptional in a craft or skill.
Freedom — working on my terms, in my rhythm.
Leadership — guiding people, shaping systems.
Innovation — solving problems and inventing possibilities.
Learning — teaching, mentoring, sharing knowledge.
Adventure — exploring spaces, industries, new worlds.
Service — helping others find clarity, direction, hope.
Legacy — creating something enduring beyond myself.
